protocol_name: Cas9/sgRNA ribonucleoprotein nucleofection using Lonza 4D nucleofector
protocol_name_html: Cas9/sgRNA ribonucleoprotein nucleofection using Lonza 4D nucleofector
before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"ak5nh","text":"Grow cells to 80-90% confluency. Maintain cells very healthy before transfection by changing media frequently. Plate enough cells for 200K cells per nucleofection reaction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39f9s","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12ki5","text":"Mg2+ is required for cleavage of DNA by Cas9. Avoid buffer containing high concentration of EDTA as it can chelate Mg2+. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fd272","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0suf","text":"Use SF cell line solution with added supplements as nucleofection solution for HEK293T cells. Don't leave cells in nucleofection solution for a long time as it might be toxic to the cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ci9n9","text":"-Trypsinize cells: Leave cells in trypsin (2 mL for a 10cm plate) at 37C for 3-5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3fmdi","text":"Note: don't leave cells in trypsin for a long period of time.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5g0i1","text":"-Add in warm media to neutralize trypsin (8 mL for a 10cm plate).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"eu345","text":"-Pellet cells at 200 x g for 10 mins. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"DAC3AD97EF0A466985F737CEB1CD1CDB","id":683348,"previous_id":683370,"previous_guid":"AF33B4D730BC4D16B22715D2F8A95C74","section":"Prepare cells (part 1) "}

{"blocks":[{"key":"elvba","text":"Remove media containging trypsin and resuspend cells in an appropriate amount of \u00a0warm 1x PBS (usually 7 mL of 1x PBS for an 80-90% confluent 10cm plate).\u00a0This step is critical as trypsin and FBS commonly contain RNAse activity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"C161842BF131423583EE06D0581DE7B9","id":683349,"previous_id":683348,"previous_guid":"DAC3AD97EF0A466985F737CEB1CD1CDB","section":"Prepare cells (part 1) "}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7c5r8","text":"-Count cells: Use the hemocytometer to count as it is more accurate and consistent in our experienece.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b1skp","text":"-Add 20ul of trypan blue with 20ul of media containing cells. Mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"b3efd","text":"NOTE: do not leave cells in trypan blue for more than 5 minutes as it is very toxic to the cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6o02n","text":"-Add about 15uL of the cell:trypan blue mixture to the hemocytometer. Count 5 squares and average them out. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d3886","text":"-Record the cell concentration (cells\/uL). In the meantime, put solution\u00a0containing cells in 37C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"4D44F08FFE7042EAA4CF28B35A291CA1","id":683350,"previous_id":683349,"previous_guid":"C161842BF131423583EE06D0581DE7B9","section":"Prepare cells (part 1)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91rkn","text":"Add 100 pmol of Cas9 to 200 pmol of gRNA very very slowly:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7aj6b","text":"-For example, if Cas9 is at 40 uM and gRNA stock at 200 uM, add 2.5 uL of 40 uM Cas9 to 0.6 uL of 200 uM gRNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"42B6AC13E2804E77B9473708A9F99794","id":683351,"previous_id":683367,"previous_guid":"6260C422FDD44970B8EA33B41B9C5606","section":"Prepare ribonucleoproteins RNPs mix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1fka4","text":"For each nucleofection, pipette 200k cells using a P200 or larger into a 1.5 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2D7D5641787745CBB81876F5C27F1F71","id":683352,"previous_id":683369,"previous_guid":"F50B970B145D4A28AD38C924823DC2F2","section":"Prepare cells (part 2)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8o82","text":"Spin 200 x g for 10 minutes at RT to pellet cells softly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"86F7FF11B64042CF838A07F98C999C66","id":683353,"previous_id":683352,"previous_guid":"2D7D5641787745CBB81876F5C27F1F71","section":"Prepare cells (part 2)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fgme5","text":"Prepare a 12-well plate containing 1 mL of media per well. Pre-warm at 37C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EEEE3CA9425047BCB44CB00F9B48878D","id":683354,"previous_id":683368,"previous_guid":"6F6E45AF7FFF428F91F2AF301BD64EF0","section":"Prepare cells (part 2)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9r3l","text":"Prepare and label wells on nucleofection cuvettes. To avoid cells staying in nucleofection solution for a long period of time in the subsequent steps, configure Lonza 4D ahead of time using the recommended cell-type program. Use SF cell line program CM-130 for HEK293T cells.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"57g0r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"bmovs","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":120148,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Amaxa SF Cell Line 4D-Nucleofector Kit S (96 RCT)","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"http:\/\/www.lonza.com\/","sku":"V4SC-2096","url":"","vendor":{"name":"Lonza","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"http:\/\/www.lonza.com\/","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":127},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}},{"type":"reagents","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":119778,"guid":"","linfor":null,"mol_weight":0,"name":"Lonza Nucleofector 4d","_public":"","reagent_vendor_link":"http:\/\/www.lonza.com\/","sku":"AAF-1002X","url":"","vendor":{"name":"Lonza","affiliation":null,"username":null,"link":"http:\/\/www.lonza.com\/","image":{"source":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png","placeholder":"https:\/\/www.protocols.io\/img\/vendors\/placeholder.png"},"badges":[],"research_interests":null,"id":127},"public":0,"can_edit":0,"stats":{"total_protocols":0}}}],"guid":"DA274A053D814564A10AB4FA9E77659A","id":683355,"previous_id":683354,"previous_guid":"EEEE3CA9425047BCB44CB00F9B48878D","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8c7rl","text":"After centrifugation, cell pellets are soft so carefully remove media from cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"06DCD5643DB440E28AB3AA93E4E03E2E","id":683356,"previous_id":683355,"previous_guid":"DA274A053D814564A10AB4FA9E77659A","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ctgs","text":"Resuspend cells in 20 uL of nucleofector solution (SF cell line solution with added supplement for HEK293T) using a P200.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"02D26AB3F90242919842B2FB6FD9D26C","id":683357,"previous_id":683356,"previous_guid":"06DCD5643DB440E28AB3AA93E4E03E2E","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74j84","text":"Add the entire RNP mix to the 20 \u00b5L resuspension and mix using a P200.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"D5BB98B0EE7F4E4A9964556F987FEDAB","id":683358,"previous_id":683357,"previous_guid":"02D26AB3F90242919842B2FB6FD9D26C","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6p0q7","text":"If using a repair template, add 1uL of 100uM single-stranded donor DNA (100 pmoles) and mix well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"2CDFD3BA6388423B90D92283BE7EE2C4","id":683359,"previous_id":683358,"previous_guid":"D5BB98B0EE7F4E4A9964556F987FEDAB","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"divm9","text":"Add nucleofection mixes to the multiwell cuvette, and cap.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CFEF9EBC20C141EB80B955C65D4FD982","id":683360,"previous_id":683359,"previous_guid":"2CDFD3BA6388423B90D92283BE7EE2C4","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6nnmv","text":"Insert cuvette into nucleofector and zap using the configured program.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"3D051FD1B0294C5EAA2241D2CFB7B583","id":683361,"previous_id":683360,"previous_guid":"CFEF9EBC20C141EB80B955C65D4FD982","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp5ud","text":"Allow cells to sit in nucleofection strips for 10 minutes post-nucleofection. This is supposed to increase efficiency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"8452168D62C949DF88F2D4DF7B2CB771","id":683362,"previous_id":683361,"previous_guid":"3D051FD1B0294C5EAA2241D2CFB7B583","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crknu","text":"Add 80uL of pre-warmed media to each well. Pipette mixture out with a P200 into your pre-warmed 12-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"0840C32951EF4B1FACD9ECE531D87EF1","id":683363,"previous_id":683362,"previous_guid":"8452168D62C949DF88F2D4DF7B2CB771","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fs292","text":"Allow cells 24 hours - 48 hours to settle and recover before attempted downstream analysis. Consider including un-zapped controls to test viability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"EA76A1910E9F4CCDA7158211A1141627","id":683364,"previous_id":683363,"previous_guid":"0840C32951EF4B1FACD9ECE531D87EF1","section":"Nucleofection"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ojmu","text":"Resuspend RNA oligos (cr and tracr) in IDT duplex buffer to final concentrations of 200 uM.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CECD4CB49AD4443195FF406E7F23D2A9","id":683365,"previous_id":683350,"previous_guid":"4D44F08FFE7042EAA4CF28B35A291CA1","section":"Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed) "}
steps.section: Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"6eltd","text":"Mix the two oligos in equimolar concentrations to a final duplex concentraition of 100 uM. For example, mixing\u00a01.25 uL of 200 uM crRNA and 1.25 uL of 200 uM tracrRNA yields 2.5 uL of 100 uM guide duplex.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"CEDC61F8D1C5431FA135B9408813E442","id":683366,"previous_id":683365,"previous_guid":"CECD4CB49AD4443195FF406E7F23D2A9","section":"Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed) "}
steps.section: Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"cbmb1","text":"Heat at 95C for 5 minutes. Alowing slow\u00a0cooling to RT by leaving tubes on block before proceeding.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6260C422FDD44970B8EA33B41B9C5606","id":683367,"previous_id":683366,"previous_guid":"CEDC61F8D1C5431FA135B9408813E442","section":"Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed) "}
steps.section: Form the crRNA : tracrRNA duplex (if needed)

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"adved","text":"Carefully remove media off of tubes.\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6F6E45AF7FFF428F91F2AF301BD64EF0","id":683368,"previous_id":683353,"previous_guid":"86F7FF11B64042CF838A07F98C999C66","section":"Prepare cells (part 2)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4uehr","text":"Incubate at RT for 10-20 minutes to let RNP form.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"F50B970B145D4A28AD38C924823DC2F2","id":683369,"previous_id":683351,"previous_guid":"42B6AC13E2804E77B9473708A9F99794","section":"Prepare ribonucleoproteins RNPs mix"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"agkvf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"AF33B4D730BC4D16B22715D2F8A95C74","id":683370,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Warm up trypsin, media and 1x PBS"}
steps.section: Warm up trypsin, media and 1x PBS
